nodes.text: No point in trying to hide, Thomas already knows I'm here.
This is a good listening point.
I don't understand it, sir. I thought that the other students here would really want to be heroes. Why else would they come to a school for heroes?
However, my classmates all seem to be here for personal gain or to learn Thief skills. They don't care about helping others or making the world a better place.
Maybe it's just the Rogues that don't care...
I'm trying very hard to fit in here, sir. I'm studying every lesson. I'm trying to learn every skill. It's just that I've never done anything like what we are expected to do for class.
I should have realized when they didn't put me in the Paladin class that I didn't belong at this school.
I'll do my best as always, sir. I just don't know if my best is good enough.
Mr. Terk accused us of being thieves! He made it obvious that he holds us all in contempt. He was even rude to the Master!
I know you've always told me to look for the goodness inside of everyone, but all I see when I look at Mr. Terk is a petty, malicious worm.
I'm sorry, sir. I'll try to do better. I know that Mr. Terk loves his mother and takes his job very seriously. He's just doing his job as he sees fit to make this place more heroic.
I shouldn't blame him if he can't see the Rogues as heroes. Sometimes I have a hard time seeing it, too.
It's such a relief that the school thief was caught.
I'm so glad that I was able to stop the school thief and convince him to return everything he stole from the school.
I was really afraid that I was going to be expelled from the school because of the thief. I don't know what I would do if that happened.
Mama's moved back to Albion. Our house and all our possessions have been sold off. I only have enough money to make it through a few months on my own.
And I don't think that there are a lot of well-paying jobs for Rogues - college dropouts or graduates.

I know Paladins are taught to follow their heart and do what is right, even if it is against the law. At least Paladins have a moral compass to judge their actions. They have the Paladin Council to consult when they have doubts.
It seems like Rogues do whatever they feel needs to be done. They break the law. They mock people in authority. They deliberately deceive people.
Rogues know the difference between right and wrong. They just don't seem to care.
How can someone like that be a hero?
The Paladin tomb in the catacombs was beautiful. The murals showed the day you defeated the dragon and the day you were proclaimed the protector of Sardonia!
I know you don't approve of elaborate funerals or ostentatious ceremonies, but the Paladin Memorial to you is inspiring.
It's just a shame that it's hidden in the depths of the Catacombs. It's so dangerous down there, they've locked the entranceway from the city. I couldn't get permission to see it.
For once, my Rogue skills came in useful as I snuck past the city guards and picked the lock on the gate. I made sure to secure the lock after I was gone.
It seems wrong to deliberately disrespect authority like that, but no one was endangered by my actions except for me.
I guess I'm starting to think like a Rogue.
Even the teachers are searching for Joel... He's not in the castle, Professor Featherstonehaugh determined that. Most people are searching the Sea Caves for a sign of him.
I think he's in the Catacombs. I believe that Joel uses the Fence down there for his blackmarket equipment. He probably was attacked by one of the Undead down there.
I like Joel. He may be more of a thief than a hero, but he's always friendly and polite. He certainly doesn't deserve to die while lost in the Catacombs.
I've got to find him!
They say that the barrier between the realm of the dead and that of the living is very thin right now. That it won't take much to draw a soul across to ours.
I know that this is wrong. You would tell me to let you rest in peace and live my own life.
I'm sorry, sir. I've got to do this. You died so suddenly. I never got to say goodbye.
And I need to ask your forgiveness for the wrong I am doing in my life. Please tell me how to make it up to you and to Mama. I need to know...
This is the last Night of the Dead. It's tonight or never.
I've got to do this.
I just hope you'll understand.
It was so good to see you again, even if it was only your ghost. I'm so glad you forgive my deceit and treachery.
I sent a letter to Mama. I doubt that she'll ever understand or forgive me for what I've done, but at least she'll know that I am fine.
My life is my own now. I don't know where it will lead me, but I know I have the courage to face it on my own terms.
I'm a lot like you. I may not be a Paladin, but I can be a Hero, too.
It's hard to believe that this school semester is almost over. I've learned so much in such a short amount of time.
Growing up, Mama always wanted me to be more like she was. I wanted to please her, but I also wanted to be more like you. I felt like I was caught in the middle between expectations and dreams.
All this time that I've been at this school, I've been in disguise - pretending to be someone else. Funny thing, I am happier being Thomas Kent than I ever was being Janet Thompson.
I guess that the most important thing I've learned here is that I can be the person I really want to be - a hero on my own terms.
Guess Thomas has stopped talking.
